intro: Diplostephium leucactinum, commonly known as the white-stemmed diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrubland and open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. It is a perennial species that thrives in warm, arid environments.
